verses.verse: Hear <WH8085> ye now what Jehovah <WH3068> saith <WH559>: Arise <WH6965>, contend <WH7378> thou before the mountains <WH2022>, and let the hills <WH1389> hear <WH8085> thy voice <WH6963>.

Hear <WH8085>, O ye mountains <WH2022>, Jehovah <WH3068>'s controversy <WH7379>, and ye enduring <WH386> foundations <WH4146> of the earth <WH776>; for Jehovah <WH3068> hath a controversy <WH7379> with his people <WH5971>, and he will contend <WH3198> with Israel <WH3478>.
O my people <WH5971>, what have I done <WH6213> unto thee <WH3811>? and wherein have I wearied thee <WH6030>? testify against me.

For I brought thee up <WH5927> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, and redeemed <WH6299> thee out of the house <WH1004> of bondage <WH5650>; and I sent <WH7971> before <WH6440> thee Moses <WH4872>, Aaron <WH175>, and Miriam <WH4813>.

O my people <WH5971>, remember <WH2142> now what Balak <WH1111> king <WH4428> of Moab <WH4124> devised <WH3289>, and what Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> answered <WH6030> him <WH7851>; remember from Shittim unto Gilgal <WH1537>, that ye may know <WH3045> the righteous <WH6666> acts of Jehovah <WH3068>.

Wherewith shall I come before <WH6923> Jehovah <WH3068>, and bow <WH3721> myself before the high <WH4791> God <WH430>? shall I come before <WH6923> him with burnt-offerings <WH5930>, with calves <WH5695> a year <WH8141> old <WH1121>?

will Jehovah <WH3068> be pleased <WH7521> with thousands <WH505> of rams <WH352>, or with ten thousands <WH7233> of rivers <WH5158> of oil <WH8081>? shall I give <WH5414> my first-born <WH1060> for my transgression <WH6588>, the fruit <WH6529> of my body <WH990> for the sin <WH2403> of my soul <WH5315>?

He hath showed <WH5046> thee <WH120>, O man, what is good <WH2896>; and what doth Jehovah <WH3068> require <WH1875> of thee <WH6213>, but to do justly <WH4941>, and to love <WH160> kindness <WH2617>, and to walk <WH3212> humbly <WH6800> with thy God <WH430>?

The voice <WH6963> of Jehovah <WH3068> crieth <WH7121> unto the city <WH5892>, and the man of wisdom <WH8454> will see <WH7200> thy name <WH8034>: hear <WH8085> ye the rod <WH4294>, and who hath appointed it <WH3259>.
Are there <WH786> yet treasures <WH214> of wickedness <WH7562> in the house <WH1004> of the wicked <WH7563>, and a scant <WH7332> measure <WH374> that is abominable <WH2194>?
Shall I be pure <WH2135> with wicked <WH7562> balances <WH3976>, and with a bag <WH3599> of deceitful <WH4820> weights <WH68>?

For the rich men <WH6223> thereof are full <WH4390> of violence <WH2555>, and the inhabitants <WH3427> thereof have spoken <WH1696> lies <WH8267>, and their tongue <WH3956> is deceitful <WH7423> in their mouth <WH6310>.
Therefore I also have smitten <WH2470> thee with a grievous wound <WH5221>; I have made thee desolate <WH8074> because of thy sins <WH2403>.

Thou shalt eat <WH398>, but not be satisfied <WH7646>; and thy humiliation <WH3445> shall be in the midst <WH7130> of thee <WH5253>: and thou shalt put away, but shalt not save <WH6403>; and that which thou savest <WH6403> will I give up <WH5414> to the sword <WH2719>.

Thou shalt sow <WH2232>, but shalt not reap <WH7114>; thou shalt tread <WH1869> the olives <WH2132>, but shalt not anoint <WH5480> thee with oil <WH8081>; and the vintage <WH8492>, but shalt not drink <WH8354> the wine <WH8492>.

For the statutes <WH2708> of Omri <WH6018> are kept <WH8104>, and all the works <WH4639> of the house <WH1004> of Ahab <WH256>, and ye walk <WH3212> in their counsels <WH4156>; that I may make <WH5414> thee a desolation <WH8047>, and the inhabitants <WH3427> thereof a hissing <WH8322>: and ye shall bear <WH5375> the reproach <WH2781> of my people <WH5971>.
